definition: to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc

sentences.english: B:Well,you may hit the ceiling at those words.
sentences.chinese: 聽到他的話你也許會勃然大怒。

sentences.english: Hongfa flew into a rage and announces the cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 鴻發勃然大怒，宣佈婚禮取消。

sentences.english: Public diplomacy is thriving in China.
sentences.chinese: 公衆外交在中國勃然興起。

sentences.english: Every day without you like a book without pages.
sentences.chinese: 沒有你的日子就像一本沒有書頁的書，勃然無味。

sentences.english: Rain stopped, I go back the country, found that spring had waken up widely.
sentences.chinese: 雨停了，回鄉下一趟，發覺春天已勃然覺醒。

sentences.english: Temper tantrums are quite likely to erupt into major wars with this combination.
sentences.chinese: 這個組合很容易勃然盛怒從而爆發戰爭。

sentences.english: He flared up and sputtered out the story.
sentences.chinese: 他勃然大怒，氣急敗壞地說出事實的真相。

sentences.english: He was vexed and flounced out of the dining room.
sentences.chinese: 他勃然大怒，猝然離開餐廳。

sentences.english: Alex flew into a rage when Mary angered him.
sentences.chinese: 當瑪麗氣阿力克斯時，他勃然大怒。

sentences.english: Talking of his disappointing son, the old father flew into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 說起他的那個不爭氣的兒子，老父親勃然大怒。

sentences.english: ShenXing smell speech flew into a rage and scolded Amy assume find out other peoples privacy.
sentences.chinese: 沈星聞言勃然大怒，訓斥艾米多管閒事打探他人隱私。

sentences.english: But I fear there is to see her again so that their hearts agitatedly.
sentences.chinese: 可是我有害怕見到她讓自己的心再起勃然。

sentences.english: The butcher was furious that the cow had tried to beg for its life.
sentences.chinese: 屠夫因爲老牛曾經求人饒命而勃然大怒。

sentences.english: Dave's dad hit the ceiling when he cut his class for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 戴維的父親知道自己被無理由斷課後勃然大怒。

sentences.english: Mrs. Reed was in such a rage that she had Jane locked in a dark room.
sentences.chinese: 裏德太太勃然大怒，叫人把簡鎖進了一間黑屋。

sentences.english: Whenever anyone teased Lily about her height, she saw red.
sentences.chinese: 每當有人拿她的身高開玩笑時，莉莉就勃然發怒。

definition: to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
to be in a thundering rage (idiom)
